properties.name: quartz.persistence.persisted
properties.description: should be set to true if quartz is configured to persist its data to a database

properties.name: quartz.persistence.usePlatformTxManager
properties.description: Only if quartz.persisted=true. if the PlatformTransactionManager should be used. Must be configured as Bean.

properties.name: quartz.persistence.dataSourceName
properties.description: Only if quartz.persisted=true. If more than one database connection is configured the name (case-sensitive) of the used DataSource must be configured

properties.name: quartz.schedulerFactory.schedulerName
properties.description: Optional: a name for the scheduler

properties.name: quartz.schedulerFactory.autoStartup
properties.description: Set whether to automatically start the scheduler after initialization.

properties.name: quartz.schedulerFactory.waitForJobsToCompleteOnShutdown
properties.description: Set whether to wait for running jobs to complete on shutdown.

properties.name: quartz.schedulerFactory.overwriteExistingJobs
properties.description: Set whether any jobs defined on this SchedulerFactoryBean should overwrite existing job definitions.

properties.name: quartz.schedulerFactory.exposeSchedulerInRepository
properties.description: Set whether to expose the Spring-managed Scheduler instance in the Quartz SchedulerRepository.

properties.name: quartz.schedulerFactory.phase
properties.description: Specify the phase in which this scheduler should be started and stopped. The startup order proceeds from lowest to highest, and the shutdown order is the reverse of that.

properties.name: quartz.schedulerFactory.startupDelay
properties.description: Set the number of seconds to wait after initialization before starting the scheduler asynchronously. Default is 0, meaning immediate synchronous startup on initialization of this bean.

properties.name: quartz.propertiesConfigLocation
properties.description: Optional: a different resource location for quartz internal properties. (http://www.quartz-scheduler.org/documentation/quartz-2.x/configuration/ConfigMain.html)

properties.name: quartz.properties
properties.description: Optional: option to manage quartz internal properties via spring application properties. (http://www.quartz-scheduler.org/documentation/quartz-2.x/configuration/ConfigMain.html)

properties.name: quartz.overrideConfigLocationProperties
properties.description: If true, the properties from spring application will override the esisting quartz properties from quartz.propertiesConfigLocation
